sections.heading: Overview of Reporting Speech
sections.content:
Japanese has several ways to report what others have said or conveyed information. The main methods use と with various verbs like 言う (say), 聞く (hear), 伝える (convey), and そうだ (I heard).

Direct: 彼は「行く」と言った "He said 'I'll go'" Indirect: 彼は行くと言った "He said he'd go" Hearsay: 雨が降るそうだ "I heard it will rain"

children.heading: Using quotation marks
children.content: 彼は「疲れた」と言った "He said 'I'm tired'" 先生は「勉強しなさい」と言いました "The teacher said 'Study!'" 母は「気をつけてね」と言った "Mom said 'Be careful'" Keeps exact words Uses 「 」quotation marks

children.heading: Removing quotation marks
children.content: Direct: 彼は「行く」と言った Indirect: 彼は行くと言った "He said he'd go" Direct: 彼女は「忙しい」と言った Indirect: 彼女は忙しいと言った "She said she's busy" Reports content, not exact words

children.heading: と言う (say/said)
children.content: 彼は来ると言った "He said he'd come" みんな楽しいと言っていた "Everyone said it was fun" Most common reporting verb

children.heading: と聞く/聞いた (hear/heard)
children.content: 彼は来ると聞いた "I heard he's coming" 雨だと聞きました "I heard it's rain" Reporting what you heard

children.heading: と伝える (convey/tell)
children.content: よろしくと伝えてください "Please tell them my regards" 彼に会議のことを伝えた "I told him about the meeting" Passing on messages

children.heading: と教える (teach/tell/inform)
children.content: 彼は道を教えてくれた "He told me the way" 先生が答えを教えた "The teacher told us the answer"

children.heading: Hearsay marker
children.content: 明日雨が降るそうだ "I heard it will rain tomorrow" 彼は来ないそうです "Apparently he's not coming" 田中さんが結婚したそうだ "I heard Tanaka got married" Based on information from others

children.heading: Plain form + と + Verb
children.content: Verbs: 行く + と言う い-adjectives: 高い + と言う な-adjectives: 便利だ + と言う Nouns: 学生だ + と言う

children.heading: そうだ pattern
children.content: Verb plain + そうだ い-adjective + そうだ な-adjective + だそうだ Noun + だそうだ

children.heading: Present reporting
children.content: 彼は来ると言っている "He says he'll come" (still saying) 彼女は忙しいと言っています "She says she's busy"

children.heading: Past reporting
children.content: 彼は来ると言った "He said he'd come" みんな難しいと言っていた "Everyone was saying it was difficult"

children.heading: Example 1: Reporting News
children.content: A: 何か聞いた？ "Did you hear anything?" B: 明日、会議があるそうだよ "I heard there's a meeting tomorrow" A: 本当？知らなかった "Really? I didn't know"

children.heading: Example 2: Conveying Messages
children.content: A: 田中さんに会ったら、何て伝える？ "What should I tell Tanaka when I see him?" B: よろしくって伝えてください "Please tell him my regards"

children.heading: Example 3: Reporting Conversation
children.content: A: 彼、何て言ってた？ "What did he say?" B: 行けないって言ってたよ "He said he can't go"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Forgetting と
children.content: Wrong: 彼は行く言った ❌ Right: 彼は行くと言った ✓ "He said he'd go" と is necessary!

children.heading: Mistake 2: Wrong tense with そうだ
children.content: Wrong: 来たそうだ ❌ (for future) Right: 来るそうだ ✓ "I heard he'll come" Use appropriate tense

children.heading: Mistake 3: Confusing そうだ types
children.content: Hearsay: 雨が降るそうだ "I heard it will rain" Appearance: 雨が降りそうだ "It looks like it will rain" Different meanings!

children.heading: Very casual reporting
children.content: 彼、来るって "He says he's coming" 明日雨だって "They say it's rain tomorrow" 忙しいって言ってた "He said he's busy" Common in conversation

children.heading: First person changes
children.content: Original: 私は行く "I'll go" Reported: 彼は行くと言った "He said he'd go" Pronouns adjust to perspective

children.heading: か for questions
children.content: 彼は「行くか」と聞いた "He asked 'Will you go?'" どこに行くか聞かれた "I was asked where I'm going" Use か for question quotes

children.heading: Quoting imperatives
children.content: 彼は「来い」と言った "He said 'Come!'" 母は「勉強しなさい」と言った "Mom said 'Study!'" 先生は早く来るように言った "The teacher said to come early"

children.heading: Similar to そうだ
children.content: 彼は来ないらしい "It seems he's not coming" / "I heard he's not coming" 雨が降るらしいよ "It seems it will rain" More casual than そうだ

children.heading: Reporting reports
children.content: 田中さんが、山田さんが来ると言っていた "Tanaka said that Yamada said he'd come" Can nest reports

children.heading: In business/formal
children.content: 社長は来週出張すると申しておりました "The president said he would go on a business trip next week" Use humble/honorific forms

children.heading: Citing sources
children.content: 天気予報によると、明日は雨だそうだ "According to the weather forecast, it will rain tomorrow" 新聞によると、事故があったそうだ "According to the newspaper, there was an accident"

children.heading: Reporting negatives
children.content: 彼は来ないと言った "He said he won't come" できないと聞いた "I heard he can't do it" 嘘じゃないそうだ "I heard it's not a lie"

children.heading: たそうだ (I heard...did)
children.content: 彼は昨日来たそうだ "I heard he came yesterday" 事故があったそうです "I heard there was an accident"

children.heading: Casual reason
children.content: A: なんで知ってるの？ "How do you know?" B: 田中さんが言ってたんだって "Because Tanaka said so"

children.heading: Casual hearsay
children.content: 明日休みだって聞いた "I heard tomorrow is a holiday" 彼、結婚するんだって "I heard he's getting married"

children.heading: Indirect commands
children.content: 先生は早く来るように言った "The teacher told me to come early" 彼は気をつけるように言ってくれた "He told me to be careful" More indirect than direct quote

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 彼は来ると言った "He said he'd come" 明日雨が降るそうだ "I heard it will rain tomorrow" 先生は「勉強しなさい」と言った "The teacher said 'Study!'"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 田中さんが、明日の会議は中止だと言っていました "Tanaka was saying tomorrow's meeting is cancelled" 天気予報によると、週末は晴れるそうです "According to the weather forecast, it will be sunny this weekend" 彼は忙しいから来られないって言ってたよ "He said he can't come because he's busy"

children.heading: Advanced
children.content: 新聞によると、経済状況が悪化しているそうだ。 専門家は、この状況はしばらく続くだろうと 言っているらしい。 "According to the newspaper, the economic situation is worsening. Experts apparently say this situation will likely continue for a while." 彼は「もう二度と会わない」と言って出て行った。 しかし、友達から聞いた話では、 後悔しているそうだ。 "He said 'I'll never see you again' and left. However, from what I heard from a friend, apparently he regrets it."

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: と言う - Say/quotation そうだ - I heard/hearsay らしい - It seems/apparently って - Casual quotation によると - According to Indirect speech - Reported speech patterns
